posts.content:
Hi!
I plan to build a lawful neutral ninja shadowdancer that is quite sneaky and also able to deal decent sneak attack damage.
How should I do it I wonder...?Rogue skills are for trapping while monk skills are for awareness.He should be as close to a real life ninja as possible,even though not very strong.
Race:Human 
Server:Arelith

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I just threw this together for you. Unfortunately, there was no room for Improved Critical. the higher your Set trap skill, the higher the DC of traps you set, so I maxxed it. I also maxxed Disable trap to have the best chance of handling traps set by other players. UMD 33 will let you use any scroll.

You could also optionally add a third gift for +2 WIS, which would give you +1 Will save and +1 AC. If you don't want to use gifts, each of which costs you a 1-point ECL penalty, causing you level more slowly, I could easy change it to use 1 gift (DEX only), or no gifts.

It just occurred to me that it might be a good idea to replace those last two Great Dexterity feats with Epic Prowess and Armor Skin. This would result in no change for your AB, +1 for your AB, and -1 for your Reflex Saves. The down side is you would lose one point on some skills, like Hide and Move Silently and Set Trap.

Something else just occurred to me. Maybe HiPS is nerfed in Arelith. If so, you might be better off with Fighter as your third class.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
The thing is that Rogue is all about those skills, and if you have lower INT, you have fewer skills.

If you use kamas, you get the Monk's unarmed attack progression, which would give you 5 attacks per round with your main hand in this build, but if you were to use katanas instead, you would get only 3 attacks per round with the main hand. Both would get 2 attacks with the off hand.
